column1:
254$Schizophrenia$4/25/2015 10:31:33 PM$Reviewer: rick, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I'm sorry to read about the side effects some of you are having.  I've been on Seroquel for years & it works well for me.  Here are some tips for overcoming the most common side effects: if you have weight gain/constipation try using a laxative with prune juice, this should help get your bowels moving and you should be able to lose the weight you have gained; if you have dry mouth or blurred vision, try drinking more fluids and using lubricating eye drops; if you are overly sleepy during the day, try taking Seroquel before you go to bed instead. Also, I would not recommend skipping breakfast - ever.  Eating a good breakfast everyday will help you feel fuller throughout the day & you won't be as tempted to snack on sugary foods.  Most important, don't abruptly stop taking Seroquel without talking to your doctor first.  To do so could have disasterous consequences.  In my case, I would starting vomiting uncontrollably.  Maybe because of a drop in blood sugar?  Don't know.  I hope this helps with Seroquel's side effects.  Be well everybody.

column1:
1763$Schizophrenia$3/1/2009 6:47:23 PM$Reviewer: Zooid, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on 1500 mg of Seroquel going on three years. I could not ask for a better treatment. I had an initial weight gain of about 15 pounds, which hasn't gone away. I take the full dose at bedtime. Within 45 minutes I am out and need at least 10 hours of sleep, or else I am so groggy that functioning for the day becomes difficult. About the second year in, my symptoms and minimal side effects began to recede exponentially. I haven't had problems with my blood sugar or have shown signs of diabetes. Constipation was a problem for a long time. One side effect that will not go away is that if I do not take the medication at night I cannot fall asleep and can literally be up for two days without feeling overly tired. So having a few doses in your car, at your friends houses, on you, and places of the like is important. If you miss doses there are noticeable spikes in symptoms that can last several days. Also keep drinking to a minimum. There has been a few times when I drank too much and had to stay in bed for about 15 hours before I had enough energy to crawl out of bed. There is also a very personal side effect with reduction of libido, sexual stimulation and production of semen. I had very weak orgasms paired with no ejaculation. I now have as regular bowel movements and orgasms as I ever had, with the exception that in the mornings, when the drug is still strong in my body, I cannot ejaculate. I am so grateful for this drug, it truly is a miracle. New users, know that it takes time for you to heal. Schizophrenia is a scary illness that tweaks the associations in your brain, it takes a while relearn reality by forging new synapses, Seroquel helped me rely more on facts than delusions and helps me think that my delusions are just that. If you have been on smaller doses for a while and your symptoms have receded little, ask for an increase, it will help. Rely on science and logic to identify your delusions and time and Seroquel will help them dissipate. God speed.
